result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Lafferty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of the September 7, 2016 Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable David J Wambach

[MK] cases #15CM323, #15CM325, #15CM425, #16CF229, #16CM27, #16CM291 called at 2:28pm.
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony J Jurek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teueber verifies victim rights compliance as to all cases. The victim impact statement is submitted as to Case 15CM325.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CF229- Counts #2 & #6.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  Mr. Lafferty makes a statement.


On Case #16CF229 -Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Lafferty to  2 years and 0 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months. 
The Court orders as a separate stand-alone order in Case #16CF229-Count #1:  6 months drivers license revocation. 
On Case #16CF229 -Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Lafferty to  2 years and 0 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  This sentence is concurrent to Count #1.

The Court finds that Mr. Lafferty  is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Lafferty is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  88 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders as condition of Extended Supervision on each count:
--to pay costs, fees, assessment 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

On Case #16CF229-Counts #4 & #5 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments
Days credit for time already served:  88 days 

On Case #15CM323 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments including $66 in subpoena fees
Days credit for time already served:  2 days 

On Case #15CM325-Counts #1, #2, & #3 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments 
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 

On Case #15CM425 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for one year, with the condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments including $43 in subpoena fees
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 

On Case #16CM27-Counts #1 & #2 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years, with condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments including $30 in subpoena fees
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 

On Case #16CM291-Counts #1 & #2 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Lafferty on Probation for two years with condition to pay costs, fees, and assessments
Days credit for time already served:  0 days 



The Court determines that Mr. Lafferty already has a DNA sample on file, so the Court does not require DNA sample provision in these cses. 
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 3:53pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Court trial on September 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 16CF229,16CM291,16CM27,15CM425,15CM323,15CM325 called together at 4:09pm [MA]
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in custody with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock indicates that there is victim rights complinace in all cases except 15CM325.

The Court will take pleas on all cases today; if the victim wishes to be present for the entrance of plea on case 15CM325, the Court will revisit that issue at the sentencing hearing.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; factual basis stipulated; 

As to Case 15CM325, Counts #1, #2, and #3: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 16CM27, Counts #1 and #2: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 16CM291, Counts #1 and #2: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 15CM425, Count #1: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 
As to Case 15CM323, Count #1: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 

As to Case 16CF229:
Mr.Lafferty waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 4:35pm--reconvene: 4:39pm
Arraignment as to Case 16CF229:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

As to Case 16CF229, Counts #1, #3, #4, and #5: pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered 

The Court will hold in abeyance all counts to which Mr. Lafferty has not plead to at this time.

The Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Lafferty guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court directs Counsel to contact the Court's JA to schedule the sentencing hearing

recess: 4:43pm

NEXT: Counsel to contact Court's JA to schedule sentencing, this sentencing is to take priority. JA please note: to address counts which pleas were not taken.
Jury trial on October 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling Order

[MK] case called at 3:18pm. 
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony J Jurek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Jurek indicates that there has been a change of plan and the Defense no longer intends to proceed to change-of-plea and sentencing in this case today.  Attorney Jurek explains that there is uncertainly about the status of whether Mr. Lafferty is currently on a PO Hold or not, so he is unsure whether or not Huber Release would be available to him or not. 
The Court schedules the case for Jury Trial. The Court issues its written Scheduling Order.
recess 3:24pm

Case called at 8:14am [mo]
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in custody with Attorney Anthony John Jurek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On State's Motion for Continuance:
--no objection from Atty. Jurek
--the Court grants the State's Motion for Continuance; directs Jury Trial be removed from the Court's calendar.

The Court directs that the FSSC remain on the calendar, to be converted to a Status Conference.

recess: 8:20am

NEXT: Status Conference on 8/8/16 at 3:00pm
Defense's Response to Court's Scheduling Order
The Court takes the matter under advisement and will rule on 7-19-2016 at the conclusion the fhe motions already scheduled
for continuance
for Continuance

Cases 15CM323 & 15CM325 called together at 1:03 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty in court, in-custody from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Anthony John Jurek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel agree that the procedural posture is that these cases are before the Court on warrant return
Atty Jurek informs the Court that he has an issue to address before addressing warrants. Have been attempting a global resolution with ADA Teuber on all of Mr. Lafferty's cases, and in review of cases, did notice that prior counsel had filed a request for substitution but that was denied as being untimely. Reviews case history and requests the Court reconsider motion for substitution, and that all assigned cases to Mr. Lafferty be assigned to another branch as well. Mr. Lafferty is being revoked on a Dodge County matter, so resolving these matters expeditiously is not formost matter. 
ADA Shock takes no position on request
Court finds that the Defendant appeared in custody, with Atty Hagemann on 9/8/15 & that Mr. Lafferty was represented by SPD at that time as they would be appointing counsel, a not guilty plea was entered at that time. The request for substitution was not filed until 10/28/15, more than a month after the initial appearance and the assigned Judge was known on 9/8/15. On 9/14/15 a notice of hearing was generated showing the Court official as Judge Wambach, so if there was confusion, since Judge Hue conducted the initial appearance, the assigned Judge should then have been known. Under 971.05(3) the Court shall even if Mr. Lafferty did not have Counsel, enter a plea at arraignment. Court denies motion for reconsideration and further concludes that the motion for substitution was not improperly denied.
ADA Shock informs the Court that they were not aware Mr. Lafferty's probation was to be revoked, requests time to speak with defense counsel
Recess: 1:22 pm Reconvene: 1:23 pm
ADA Shock informs the Court that they withdraw motion to modify bond and request that the bond be reinstated, presents basis including that the Defendant will be in-custody and will be able to be brought to court
No objection from Atty Jurek
Court concludes that without imposition of cash, Mr. Lafferty will appear. Court considers warrants executed and orders them withdrawn from any database.
Atty Jurek informs the Court that they have no issue to leave matters scheduled as are, but do believe there is some officer availability issues so there may be a request to reschedule trial in the future
Recess: 1:27 pm

NEXT: BOTH CASES TO REMAIN AS SCHEDULED

[MK] cases #15CM323 & #15CM325 called at 1:37pm. 
Defendant Jesse J. Lafferty appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Lafferty verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaints are correct. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaints admitted, readings waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered on both cases; speedy trial waived by the Defense

The Court requires a $1,500  Signature Bond (applies to both cases), with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Kadjah Newson or their one year old son
--no contact with Aubrey Dominguez or Kysten Marinez
--no possession of 0C Spray 
--no presence at 113 S. 10th Street in Watertown
recess 1:41pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/7/15 at 10:40am   (2) Status Conference to be scheduled after the Pretrial date 10/30/ at 10:30am
